description: Música que explora nuevas formas de composición y producción sonora.

substyles.name: Glitch
substyles.description: Experimental genre that uses errors and digital distortions as creative elements.

substyles.name: Noise
substyles.description: Experimental genre characterized by abrasive and distorted sounds.

substyles.name: Microsound
substyles.description: Experimental genre that works with very short and minimalist sounds.

substyles.name: Musique Concrète
substyles.description: A genre that utilizes recorded sounds from everyday life as its primary musical material.
substyles.example: Pierre Schaeffer - Étude aux chemins de fer

substyles.name: Plunderphonics
substyles.description: Música creada mediante la manipulación de grabaciones preexistentes.

substyles.name: IDM (Intelligent Dance Music)
substyles.description: Género de música electrónica experimental con estructuras rítmicas complejas.

substyles.name: Braindance
substyles.description: Subgénero de IDM con énfasis en ritmos complejos y melodías intrincadas.

substyles.name: Drill 'n' Bass
substyles.description: Variante de IDM caracterizada por ritmos de batería rápidos y complejos.

substyles.name: Glitch Hop
substyles.description: Fusión de elementos de glitch e IDM con ritmos de hip-hop.

substyles.name: Breakcore
substyles.description: Estilo de IDM caracterizado por ritmos de breakbeat intensos y caóticos, a menudo con samples distorsionados.

substyles.name: Ambient IDM
substyles.description: Fusión de IDM con elementos de música ambient, creando paisajes sonoros atmosféricos y rítmicos.

description: A genre of electronic music characterized by a repetitive four on the floor beat, synthesized sounds, and a minimalist aesthetic.

substyles.name: Detroit Techno
substyles.description: Techno style that originated in Detroit in the late 80s.

substyles.name: Classic Detroit Techno
substyles.description: The original sound of Detroit Techno, known for its soulful melodies and hypnotic grooves.

substyles.name: Detroit Techno 2.0
substyles.description: A modern take on Detroit Techno, often incorporating elements of minimal techno and dub techno.
substyles.example: Octave One Feat. Ann Saunderson - Blackwater

substyles.name: Techno Soul
substyles.description: A fusion of Detroit Techno and soul music, characterized by its use of soulful vocals and melodies.

substyles.name: Hard Detroit Techno
substyles.description: A more aggressive and intense form of Detroit Techno.

substyles.name: Minimal Detroit Techno
substyles.description: A stripped-back and minimalist approach to Detroit Techno.

substyles.name: Acid Techno
substyles.description: Techno style characterized by the use of the TB-303 synthesizer.

substyles.name: Acid House
substyles.description: A fusion of acid techno and house music.
substyles.example: Mr. Fingers - Can You Feel It

substyles.name: Acid Breaks
substyles.description: A blend of acid techno and breakbeat.
substyles.example: Josh Wink - Higher State of Consciousness

substyles.name: Acid Trance
substyles.description: A combination of acid techno and trance music.

substyles.name: Minimal Techno
substyles.description: Techno style characterized by its minimalist and repetitive sound.

substyles.name: Microhouse
substyles.description: A minimalist subgenre of techno with subtle, intricate rhythms.

substyles.name: Minimal Dub
substyles.description: A fusion of minimal techno and dub music.

substyles.name: Deep Minimal Techno
substyles.description: A deeper and more atmospheric take on minimal techno.

substyles.name: Click Techno
substyles.description: A subgenre of minimal techno characterized by its use of clicks and other rhythmic noises.

substyles.name: Hard Techno
substyles.description: Faster and more aggressive techno.

substyles.name: Hard Acid
substyles.description: A fusion of hard techno and acid techno.

substyles.name: Industrial Techno
substyles.description: A darker and more industrial-influenced form of hard techno.
substyles.example: Karl O Connor & Peter Sutton - Join Us In Paradise

substyles.name: Schranz
substyles.description: A fast and distorted form of hard techno.

substyles.name: Deep House
substyles.description: House style characterized by a softer and more atmospheric sound.
substyles.example: Larry Heard - Can You Feel It

substyles.name: Soulful House
substyles.description: Deep house with soulful vocals and melodies.

substyles.name: Dub House
substyles.description: Deep house with dub influences, featuring spacious echoes and basslines.

substyles.name: Atmospheric House
substyles.description: Deep house with atmospheric pads, creating a dreamy and spacious vibe.

substyles.name: Chill House
substyles.description: Laid-back and melodic deep house, perfect for relaxing or casual listening.

substyles.name: Tropical House
substyles.description: Upbeat and summery deep house, often featuring marimba melodies and tropical sounds.

substyles.name: Tech House
substyles.description: House style that combines elements of techno and house.
substyles.example: Armand Van Helden - Give Me Your Loving

substyles.name: Minimal Tech House
substyles.description: Tech house with a minimalist approach, focusing on stripped-back grooves and subtle details.

substyles.name: Funky Tech House
substyles.description: Tech house with funky basslines and grooves, often incorporating elements of disco and funk.

substyles.name: Progressive Tech House
substyles.description: Tech house with a progressive structure, building up tension and releasing it with melodic elements.

substyles.name: Tribal Tech House
substyles.description: Tech house with tribal percussion and rhythms, creating a primal and energetic vibe.

substyles.name: Tech Funk
substyles.description: A fusion of tech house and funk, featuring funky basslines, groovy rhythms, and soulful vocals.
substyles.example: Adam Freeland - We Want Your Soul

substyles.name: Garage House
substyles.description: House style that originated in New York clubs.
substyles.example: Masters At Work - I Can't Get No Sleep

substyles.name: UK Garage
substyles.description: Originated in the UK, blending house, R&B, and jungle influences.

substyles.name: Speed Garage
substyles.description: Faster and more energetic variant of UK Garage.
substyles.example: DJ Armand Van Helden - U Don't Know Me

substyles.name: 2-step Garage
substyles.description: Characterized by syncopated rhythms and soulful melodies.

substyles.name: Bassline
substyles.description: Originated in Sheffield, characterized by its heavy basslines and 4/4 beats.

substyles.name: Future Garage
substyles.description: An evolution of UK Garage with influences from dubstep and future bass.

substyles.name: Grime
substyles.description: A darker and more aggressive offshoot of UK Garage, with influences from drum and bass and hip-hop.

substyles.name: Dubstep Garage
substyles.description: A fusion of 2-step garage and dubstep, with a focus on sub-bass frequencies and half-time rhythms.

substyles.name: Chicago House
substyles.description: Style that originated house music.

substyles.name: Classic Chicago House
substyles.description: The original sound of Chicago House, characterized by its soulful melodies, driving basslines, and uplifting vibes.

substyles.name: Acid House
substyles.description: A subgenre of Chicago House that emerged in the mid-1980s, characterized by the squeaky, hypnotic sounds of the Roland TB-303 synthesizer.

substyles.name: Ghetto House
substyles.description: A faster, rawer form of house music that emerged in Chicago in the 1990s, often featuring explicit lyrics and minimal production.

substyles.name: Jackin' House
substyles.description: A high-energy, funk-influenced subgenre of Chicago house characterized by its infectious, 'jacking' rhythm.

substyles.name: Piano House
substyles.description: A subgenre of house music that prominently features piano riffs and melodies.
substyles.example: Fingers Inc. - Can You Feel It

substyles.name: Goa Trance
substyles.description: Trance style that originated in Goa, India, in the late 80s.

substyles.name: Psychedelic Goa
substyles.description: A more psychedelic-oriented subgenre of Goa Trance.

substyles.name: Progressive Trance
substyles.description: Trance style characterized by its more melodic and progressive sound.

substyles.name: Melodic Progressive Trance
substyles.description: Progressive Trance with a focus on melodic elements.

substyles.name: Dark Progressive Trance
substyles.description: Progressive Trance with darker and more atmospheric elements.

substyles.name: Progressive Psytrance
substyles.description: A fusion of Progressive Trance and Psytrance elements.

substyles.name: Psytrance
substyles.description: Trance style characterized by its more psychedelic and rhythmic sound.

substyles.name: Full-on Psytrance
substyles.description: A high-energy subgenre of Psytrance.

substyles.name: Dark Psytrance
substyles.description: A darker and more intense subgenre of Psytrance.

substyles.name: Suomisaundi
substyles.description: A Finnish style of Psytrance known for its quirky sounds.

substyles.name: Uplifting Trance
substyles.description: Trance characterized by euphoric sounds.

substyles.name: Anthem Trance
substyles.description: Uplifting Trance with a focus on memorable melodies and buildups.

substyles.name: Orchestral Trance
substyles.description: Uplifting Trance incorporating orchestral elements.

substyles.name: Vocal Trance
substyles.description: Uplifting Trance featuring prominent vocals.

substyles.name: Hard Trance
substyles.description: A harder and faster subgenre of Trance music.

substyles.name: Hard Uplifting Trance
substyles.description: A fusion of Hard Trance and Uplifting Trance elements.

substyles.name: Hard Dance Trance
substyles.description: A blend of Hard Trance and Hard Dance music.

substyles.name: Hard Progressive Trance
substyles.description: A combination of Hard Trance and Progressive Trance styles.

description: Electronic music genre characterized by fast and syncopated rhythms.

substyles.name: Neurofunk
substyles.description: Drum and bass style characterized by its darker and more aggressive sound.

substyles.name: Darkstep
substyles.description: Subgenre of drum and bass with a darker and heavier sound.

substyles.name: Techstep
substyles.description: Subgenre of drum and bass that incorporates elements of techno.

substyles.name: Liquid Drum and Bass
substyles.description: Drum and bass style characterized by its smoother and more melodic sound.

substyles.name: Liquid Funk
substyles.description: Subgenre of liquid drum and bass with funk influences.

substyles.name: Jazzstep
substyles.description: Subgenre of liquid drum and bass with jazz influences.

substyles.name: Atmospheric Drum and Bass
substyles.description: Subgenre of liquid drum and bass with a more ambient and atmospheric sound.

substyles.name: Jump Up
substyles.description: Drum and bass style characterized by its fast and energetic rhythm.

substyles.name: Party Drum and Bass
substyles.description: Subgenre of jump up with a more festive and lively sound.

substyles.name: Happy Jump Up
substyles.description: Subgenre of jump up with a more cheerful and optimistic sound.

substyles.name: Darkstep
substyles.description: Subgenre of drum and bass with a darker and heavier sound.

substyles.name: Drumfunk
substyles.description: Subgenre of drum and bass that focuses on rhythms and percussions.

substyles.name: Brostep
substyles.description: Dubstep style characterized by its more aggressive and distorted sound.
substyles.example: Skrillex - Scary Monsters and Nice Sprites

substyles.name: Aggressive Dubstep
substyles.description: A subgenre of brostep with an even more intense and heavy sound.

substyles.name: Melodic Brostep
substyles.description: A subgenre of brostep that incorporates more melodic elements.

substyles.name: Melodic Dubstep
substyles.description: A subgenre of dubstep that focuses on more melodic and emotional elements.

substyles.name: Chillstep
substyles.description: A subgenre of melodic dubstep with a more relaxed and atmospheric sound.

substyles.name: UK Dubstep
substyles.description: The original style of dubstep that emerged in the UK, known for its deep basslines and minimal, dark rhythms.

substyles.name: Dark Dubstep
substyles.description: Focuses on ominous atmospheres, often incorporating elements of ambient or drone music.
substyles.example: Datsik Feat. Snoop Dogg- Smoke Bomb

substyles.name: Wonky Dubstep
substyles.description: Emphasizes irregular rhythms and syncopation, often using unusual time signatures.

substyles.name: Riddim
substyles.description: A style of dubstep that emphasizes repetitive, minimalistic basslines and rhythms.

substyles.name: Heavy Riddim
substyles.description: Characterized by intense, distorted basslines and aggressive sound design.

substyles.name: Melodic Riddim
substyles.description: Combines the repetitive structure of riddim with more melodic elements and atmospheric soundscapes.

substyles.name: Deep Dubstep
substyles.description: A subgenre of dubstep known for its emphasis on deep, sub-bass frequencies and a slower tempo.

substyles.name: Dub Techno Dubstep
substyles.description: Blends the deep bass and spaciousness of dub techno with the rhythmic elements of dubstep.

substyles.name: Halftime Dubstep
substyles.description: Employs a slower tempo and often features a half-time drum pattern, creating a more relaxed and hypnotic vibe.

description: A genre of electronic music that emphasizes tone and atmosphere over traditional musical structure or rhythm.
example: Brian Eno - Ambient 1: Music for Airports

substyles.name: Dark Ambient
substyles.description: Ambient with a darker and more sinister sound, often evoking a sense of unease or dread.

substyles.name: Industrial Ambient
substyles.description: Combines dark ambient with industrial music elements, often featuring mechanical and metallic sounds.
substyles.example: Raison d'être - The Stains of the Embodied Sacrifice

substyles.name: Lovecraftian Ambient
substyles.description: Dark ambient inspired by the cosmic horror of H.P. Lovecraft's works, often featuring otherworldly and unsettling soundscapes.

substyles.name: Psybient
substyles.description: A fusion of ambient and psychedelic trance elements, often featuring ethereal melodies and hypnotic rhythms.

substyles.name: Psydub
substyles.description: A combination of psychedelic and dub music styles, characterized by deep basslines, echoing effects, and psychedelic textures.
substyles.example: Ott - The Queen of All Everything

substyles.name: Forest Psybient
substyles.description: Psybient with a focus on natural and organic sounds, often evoking the atmosphere of a mystical forest.

substyles.name: New Age Ambient
substyles.description: Ambient music with a focus on creating a serene and uplifting atmosphere, often incorporating elements of world music and nature sounds.

substyles.name: Celtic Ambient
substyles.description: New Age ambient incorporating Celtic musical elements and instrumentation.

substyles.name: Meditation Ambient
substyles.description: Ambient music specifically designed for meditation and relaxation practices.

substyles.name: Drone Ambient
substyles.description: Minimalist ambient music characterized by long, sustained sounds and drones, often creating a hypnotic and immersive listening experience.
substyles.example: Stars of the Lid - The Tired Sounds of Stars of the Lid

substyles.name: Drone Metal
substyles.description: A fusion of drone ambient and metal music, characterized by heavily distorted and sustained guitar tones.
substyles.example: Sunn O))) - It Took the Night to Believe

substyles.name: Microtonal Drone
substyles.description: Drone ambient that explores microtonal tunings and unconventional harmonic relationships.
substyles.example: Eliane Radigue - Trilogie de la Mort

substyles.name: Space Ambient
substyles.description: Ambient music that evokes the vastness and mystery of outer space, often using synthesizers to create cosmic soundscapes.

substyles.name: Berlin School Ambient
substyles.description: A style of space ambient influenced by the Berlin School of electronic music, often featuring sequenced synthesizers and cosmic textures.

description: A broad category of electronic dance music styles characterized by prominent bass lines and rhythms.

substyles.name: Miami Bass
substyles.description: A booming, bass-heavy style of hip-hop and dance music that originated in Miami.

substyles.name: Bass Music
substyles.description: A general term for bass-heavy electronic dance music, often used interchangeably with Miami Bass.
substyles.example: DJ Magic Mike - Feel the Bass

substyles.name: Electro Bass
substyles.description: A fusion of Miami Bass with electro music, featuring prominent use of drum machines and synthesizers.

substyles.name: Ghetto Bass
substyles.description: A raw, stripped-down variant of Miami Bass, often featuring explicit lyrics and minimal production.

substyles.name: Footwork
substyles.description: Fast-paced electronic dance music style originating from Chicago, characterized by rapid rhythms and repetitive vocal samples.

substyles.name: Juke
substyles.description: A precursor to footwork, characterized by its fast tempo and repetitive vocal samples.

substyles.name: Chicago Footwork
substyles.description: The original style of footwork that emerged from Chicago's dance battles.
substyles.example: RP Boo - Bangin' On King Dr.

substyles.name: Future bass
substyles.description: A style of electronic dance music characterized by synthesized bass lines and influences from trap, R&B, and pop.
substyles.example: Flume - Never Be Like You feat. Kai

substyles.name: Kawaii future bass
substyles.description: A subgenre of future bass incorporating cute, playful sounds and Japanese pop culture influences.

substyles.name: Jungle
substyles.description: A genre of electronic music characterized by fast breakbeats and heavy bass lines.

substyles.name: Ragga Jungle
substyles.description: A fusion of jungle with reggae and dancehall elements.

substyles.name: Jungle Terror
substyles.description: A fusion of hardstyle, big room house, and trap, known for its aggressive sounds and tribal influences.

substyles.name: Midtempo bass
substyles.description: A genre blending elements of dubstep, electro house, and techno, typically with a tempo around 100-125 BPM.

substyles.name: Trap (EDM)
substyles.description: A style of EDM influenced by hip-hop, characterized by heavy bass, layered synthesizers, and rapid hi-hats.

substyles.name: UK bass
substyles.description: An umbrella term for various bass-heavy electronic music styles originating from the UK, including dubstep, grime, and garage.

substyles.name: Wave
substyles.description: A genre blending elements of trap, grime, and emo, known for its emotional melodies and heavy bass.

substyles.name: Hardwave
substyles.description: A more aggressive and intense subgenre of wave music.

description: A broad style of electronic music characterized by its use of broken drum patterns.

substyles.name: Acid breaks
substyles.description: A fusion of breakbeat and acid house, featuring the distinctive sound of the Roland TB-303 synthesizer.

substyles.name: Baltimore club
substyles.description: A style of breakbeat house music that originated in Baltimore, known for its aggressive tempos and heavy bass.
substyles.example: Rod Lee - Dance My Pain Away

substyles.name: Jersey club
substyles.description: A faster, more aggressive offshoot of Baltimore club that originated in Newark, New Jersey.

substyles.name: Philly club
substyles.description: A regional variant of Baltimore club that originated in Philadelphia, often incorporating elements of hip-hop and R&B.

substyles.name: Big beat
substyles.description: A style of electronic music that typically uses heavy breakbeats and synthesizer-generated loops and patterns.
substyles.example: The Chemical Brothers - Hey Boy Hey Girl

substyles.name: Chemical Breaks
substyles.description: A style of big beat associated with The Chemical Brothers, characterized by its psychedelic and rock influences.
substyles.example: The Chemical Brothers - Block Rockin' Beats

substyles.name: Funky Breaks
substyles.description: A fusion of big beat with funk elements, often incorporating live instrumentation and sampling.

substyles.name: Breakbeat hardcore
substyles.description: An early style of hardcore electronic dance music that emerged in the UK in the early 1990s.

substyles.name: Darkcore
substyles.description: A darker, more atmospheric subgenre of breakbeat hardcore that emerged in the early 1990s.

substyles.name: Hardcore breaks
substyles.description: A fusion of breakbeat and hardcore techno, characterized by fast tempos and aggressive sounds.

substyles.name: Broken beat
substyles.description: A style of electronic music characterized by irregular, shuffled rhythms.

substyles.name: Nu skool breaks
substyles.description: A style of breakbeat that emerged in the late 1990s, incorporating elements of techno and electro.

substyles.name: Florida breaks
substyles.description: A regional style of breakbeat that originated in Orlando, Florida in the 1990s.
substyles.example: Dynamix II - Just Give the DJ a Break

substyles.name: Progressive breaks
substyles.description: A subgenre of breakbeat incorporating elements of progressive house and trance.

substyles.name: Psychedelic breakbeat
substyles.description: A fusion of breakbeat and psychedelic trance, often featuring complex rhythms and trippy sounds.

substyles.name: Downtempo
substyles.description: A relaxed, slower-paced electronic music style.

substyles.name: Lo-fi Hip Hop
substyles.description: A style of downtempo music that combines elements of hip-hop and chill-out electronica.

substyles.name: Nu jazz
substyles.description: A blend of jazz elements with electronic beats and ambient textures.

substyles.name: Bossa nova chill
substyles.description: A relaxed fusion of bossa nova rhythms and electronic textures, often used in chill-out contexts.

substyles.name: Lounge
substyles.description: Relaxed, sophisticated background music often associated with bars and hotels.

substyles.name: Psybient
substyles.description: A fusion of ambient and psychedelic trance elements.

substyles.name: Psydub
substyles.description: A combination of psychedelic and dub music styles.

substyles.name: Trip hop
substyles.description: A fusion of hip-hop and electronic music with a relaxed, atmospheric sound.

substyles.name: Trip rock
substyles.description: A blend of trip hop and rock music elements.

substyles.name: Ambient Dub
substyles.description: A fusion of ambient and dub music, characterized by spacious soundscapes and deep basslines.

substyles.name: Balearic Beat
substyles.description: A blend of electronic, pop, and Mediterranean sounds, originating from Ibiza.

substyles.name: Chillwave
substyles.description: A genre combining elements of pop, hip-hop, and electronic music with nostalgic 1980s synth sounds.
substyles.example: Washed Out - Feel It All Around

substyles.name: Vaporwave
substyles.description: An internet-born microgenre known for its nostalgic or surrealist engagement with consumer culture.
substyles.example: Macintosh Plus - リサフランク420 / 現代のコンピュー

substyles.name: Synthwave
substyles.description: Retro-style electronic music inspired by 1980s film soundtracks and video games.

description: A genre of dance music characterized by four-on-the-floor beats and prominent use of strings and horns.

substyles.name: Afro/cosmic music
substyles.description: A fusion of disco with African and space-themed elements.

substyles.name: Electro-disco
substyles.description: A blend of disco and electronic music.
substyles.example: Giorgio Moroder feat. Donna Summer - I Feel Love

substyles.name: Euro disco
substyles.description: A European variant of disco music.

substyles.name: Italo disco
substyles.description: An Italian variant of Euro disco.

substyles.name: Nu-disco
substyles.description: A modern revival of disco music incorporating elements of house and funk.

substyles.name: Space disco
substyles.description: A subgenre of disco with futuristic and space-themed elements.

description: A fusion genre that blends elements of funk, soul, and electronic music, characterized by groovy rhythms, soulful melodies, and modern production techniques.

substyles.name: Acid Jazz
substyles.description: A fusion of jazz, soul, and funk with electronic elements, often featuring improvisation.

substyles.name: Jazz House
substyles.description: A blend of house music rhythms with jazz influences, often featuring live instrumentation.

substyles.name: Lounge Jazz
substyles.description: A smooth, relaxed fusion of jazz and electronic beats, often used in chill or lounge environments.
substyles.example: Thievery Corporation - The Richest Man in Babylon

substyles.name: Broken Beat
substyles.description: A subgenre of electronic music with irregular drum patterns, drawing from jazz, funk, and soul influences.

substyles.name: Funktronica
substyles.description: A modern fusion of funk and electronic music, characterized by groovy basslines and electronic production.

substyles.name: Future Funk
substyles.description: A genre blending funky grooves with modern electronic production, often featuring disco and synth elements.

substyles.name: Nu-Funk
substyles.description: A contemporary take on funk music with modern production techniques and electronic influences.

substyles.name: Synth-funk
substyles.description: A blend of funk and electronic synth sounds, often characterized by prominent use of synthesizers.

substyles.name: Electro Funk
substyles.description: A fusion of electronic music and funk, characterized by the use of drum machines and synthesizers.
substyles.example: Zapp - More Bounce to the Ounce

substyles.name: Electroclash
substyles.description: A fusion of electro, punk, and synthpop, often with a retro, underground aesthetic.

description: A genre rooted in harsh, mechanical sounds and dystopian themes, often blending elements of electronic, noise, and experimental music. Post-industrial extends these concepts, exploring darker, atmospheric territories.

substyles.name: Industrial Techno
substyles.description: A fusion of techno music with the abrasive, mechanical sound of industrial music, characterized by distorted kicks and aggressive rhythms.
substyles.example: Perc - Look What Your Love Has Done To Me

substyles.name: EBM
substyles.description: Electronic Body Music, a genre combining industrial music with danceable beats, often featuring heavy synthesizers and dark themes.

substyles.name: Dark Electro
substyles.description: A subgenre of EBM with darker, more atmospheric soundscapes, often characterized by sinister melodies and complex synth work.

substyles.name: Futurepop
substyles.description: A melodic, more accessible subgenre of EBM that combines industrial sounds with trance-like melodies and futuristic themes.

substyles.name: Aggrotech
substyles.description: A harsher, more aggressive form of EBM, often featuring distorted vocals, heavy beats, and themes of violence or dystopia.

substyles.name: Post-Industrial
substyles.description: A genre that evolved from industrial music, incorporating darker, more ambient soundscapes, often exploring themes of isolation and decay.
substyles.example: Coil - The First Five Minutes After Death

substyles.name: Dark Ambient
substyles.description: A subgenre characterized by droning, eerie soundscapes, often invoking feelings of dread, isolation, or mysticism.

substyles.name: Witch House
substyles.description: A dark, occult-inspired fusion of electronic music, industrial, and hip-hop, characterized by heavy use of reverb and chopped vocals.

description: A genre that combines elements of pop music and rock, often featuring catchy melodies, electronic instrumentation, and innovative production techniques.

substyles.name: Synth-pop
substyles.description: A genre characterized by the use of synthesizers and electronic instruments, blending catchy pop melodies with futuristic sounds.
substyles.example: Pet Shop Boys - West End Girls

substyles.name: Electropop
substyles.description: A contemporary blend of pop and electronic music, often featuring catchy hooks and danceable beats.

substyles.name: Futurepop
substyles.description: A melodic subgenre of synth-pop that combines electronic music with elements of EBM and trance.

substyles.name: New Wave
substyles.description: A genre that emerged in the late 1970s, characterized by a blend of punk rock, pop, and electronic elements.
substyles.example: The Cars - Just What I Needed

substyles.name: Electronic Rock
substyles.description: A fusion of rock music and electronic elements, often featuring guitar riffs alongside synthesizers and drum machines.

substyles.name: Dance-punk
substyles.description: A genre that blends elements of punk rock with electronic music, characterized by a danceable beat and a raw sound.

substyles.name: Indie Electronic
substyles.description: A genre combining indie rock and electronic music, often featuring unconventional sounds and lo-fi aesthetics.

substyles.name: Dance-pop
substyles.description: A genre of pop music designed for danceability, characterized by upbeat tempos and catchy melodies.
